data.title: General Improvements to Pipeline Gtk implementation

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This PR fixes stuff mentioned in #4457 for Gtk Pipeline Tool.

Stuff done:
- Added "Open With", Linux only
- Added Undo/Redo toolbar buttons
- Added Cancel toolbar button which appears while the build is running, and build/rebuild buttons hide
- Updated reference dialog to mimic WinForms one
- Updated how reference property is displayed in propertygrid
- Made headerbar separator invisible in case build/rebuild/cancel build aren't visible
- Allowed user scrolling of build output possible
- Smoother scrolling
- Fixed opening of files that contain spaces

Update no. 1:
- Toolbar items / Headerbar items are now connected to actions, this means that changing something on action will change them as well
- Headerbar now has a proper menu

Update no. 2:
- Fixed pressing open and then canceling creating an empty base item
- Separate "Exclude from Project" and "Delete" options
- Made build output cursor invisible (not mouse cursor, text cursor, text can still be selected)

data.title: Add Filters To Filter View
data.body:
The new filter view in the Pipeline tool should have additional options to allow you to actually filter content.  
- Show/hide skipping.
- Show/hide successful content builds.
- Show/hide warnings.
- ???

Without something like this the filter view is just a more verbose version of the current output window.

data.title: Pipeline Tool Issues
data.body:
There are a bunch of issues I noticed when using the MonoGame Pipeline tool on Windows.  Some of this might be Windows specific... some of it might apply the to GTK frontend as well.
- We should include the open project name in the title bar (see VS).
- It isn't obvious if a content build is active occurring.
- We lost the build succeeded/failed message and build time at the end of the output log.
- The control border around the filter view is different that that around the output view.
- The output and filter views fights the user set scrollbar position.
- Text selection in the output view doesn't work correctly.
- The filter view should have buttons to allow you to filter stuff out... like not showing skipping messages.
- The 'References' property value should show a `;` separated string of assembly names.
- Undo/Redo should be visible on the toolbar.
- Toolbar icons do not update to disabled when a build is triggered.

data.title: [android] Fix Android Orientation
data.body:
The OrientationChanged Event was occuring too early. It was
happening BEFORE the change had occured as a result the
Viewport property was completely wrong and had the old values.

data.title: [android] Fix Accelerometer state.
data.body:
The state valiable is NOT updated after the accelerometer has
been created so it always returns NotSupported..

data.title: [OpenTK] DPI scaling is ignored by MonoGame
data.body:
Windows (with 4K displays) and OS X (with Retina displays) are using a high DPI mode which scales everything to fit high resolutions.

OpenTK has internal mechanisms to handle that automatically, but MonoGame overrides the `Viewport` size (because it assumes it to be the same as the backbuffer, which is not correct when it comes to DPI scaling) and this results in cropped or too big viewport.

I know that OpenTK is being replaced, but I feel like this is still an important issue and I'm leaving this here so we can keep that in mind when SDL2 will be in use (note that SDL2 <= 2.0.2 doesn't have DPI scaling support).

data.title: Fixed SoundEffect.Play does nothing on Android #4452
data.body:
The OpenALSoundController was not being initialized before
the SoundEffects were trying to load.

Tested on Android and MacOS (DesktopGL) works fine

data.title: SoundEffect.Play does nothing on Android
data.body:
Latest unstable release, Music seems to play ok but sounds effects seem to do nothing. 
We probably should fix this (if its an issue and not must me) before the 3.5 release.

data.title: Platform Identifer Bug
data.body:
Looks like we have a mismatch in `TargetPlatform`  and the platform identifiers written to the XNBs.

The enumeration for `TargetPlatform` has no OUYA anymore:
  https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/TargetPlatform.cs#L68

Yet the platform identifiers written to the XNB does include OUYA:
 https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Serialization/Compiler/ContentWriter.cs#L53

This means everything after native client in that list has the wrong platform identifier written to the XNBs.

data.title: Model renders black with SkinnedEffect
data.body:
I have a skinned fbx model which renders perfectly using BasicEffect. But as soon as I select the SkinnedEffect in the pipeline tool (and in my code), it turns completely black. (using default lighting, specular power 16 and white color).

On my previous laptop it worked perfectly, but now for some reason it doesn't want to render properly anymore. I've tried to run it on another pc, but sadly I'm getting the same result. This laptop supports DX12 so that shouldn't be a problem.

When I use alphablend BlendState the model doesn't render at all. And when I use opaque, it renders black.

I'm using the latest code from the development branch.

Could this be a bug? Or is there something I should supply to the SkinnedEffect to make it work.
I can supply more info if needed, but I hope someone knows an easy fix for this.

data.title: Prevent OpenAL calls with 0 buffers or empty buffers
data.body:
This fixes an error related to differences across OpenAL implementations.

> `AL.BufferData()` generates an "invalid value" error if the `size` parameter is `0` on OS X, while it does nothing on Windows. Same applies to `AL.SourceQueueBuffers()`.

I've simply added checks so that it doesn't crash `Song` anymore.

Fixes #4440

This however raises another issue: this shouldn't be happening. The original cause is `VorbisReader.ReadSamples()` occasionally failing to read the ogg stream by returning `0` and skipping a few samples or simply reset the stream (it loses track of the stream position). Which means that there is a bug in NVorbis, or something that Mono don't like in NVorbis.

This means that, even though it doesn't crash anymore, it may occasionally skip a few seconds of a `Song`, replay a previous buffer, or reset it at worse. It also seems to break the stream initial position, make `Song` to start at random position after the first occurrence of this issue.

@dellis1972 Do you find acceptable to merge this until I can figure out what's wrong with NVorbis?

Even though the original `OggStreamer` may be a couple years old now, maybe @renaudbedard could have some thoughts about this (did you experienced similar NVorbis issues on Mono?).

data.title: How can I create MonoGameSetup.exe from Monogame.develop distribution?
data.body:
I want to increase the number of bones in the skinnedmodels.cs, and in general I'd like to become able to collaborate in the monogame development. Once I run protobuild and created the dll with visual studio 2015, how can I install the packages in the right directories. Monogame distributions use MonoGameSetup.exe, but I cannot find how I can build it in the Monogame-develop distribution.

Thank you,
Alessandro

data.title: [OpenAL] Occasionnal OggStreamer crash
data.body:
I've only seen this happening on OS X, but given the nature of the problem, I'm pretty sure it can happen on any OS depending on the decoding performance.

A crash can occur in `OggStreamer.FillBuffer()` on the `AL.BufferData()` call with an `Invalid Value` AL error.

AL documentation about this error:

> The size parameter is not valid for the format specified, the buffer is in use, or the data is a NULL pointer. 

I haven't managed to reproduce it in a debug environment yet, but I'm pretty certain that `size` and `format` are always correct, and that `data` can't be NULL because `CastBuffer()` would throw an exception before the `ALHelper.Check()`. Hence, it most probably mean that a buffer is still in use, though it shouldn't if `AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers()` returned it...

UPDATE: got it! I'm testing it before opening a PR.

FYI, it is a discrepancy of OpenAL across platforms. `AL.BufferData()` generates this error if the `size` parameter is `0` on OS X, while it does nothing on Windows. Same applies to `AL.SourceQueueBuffers()`.

data.title: SpriteFont.MeasureString fix
data.body:
MonoGame's `SpriteFont.MeasureString` was in some cases returning a larger width than XNA was.

I've added some new tests which expose this issue, then fixed the problem in MonoGame.

data.title: ShaderProfile Refactor

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This PR is the first baby step towards making the content pipeline more easily extendable for new platforms.

Here I refactored the existing `enum ShaderProfile` into a class that knows how to perform various platform specific steps of the effect compiling process.

The next step here is to remove specific values like `ShaderProfile.OpenGL` and `ShaderProfile.DirectX_11' and allow for new profiles to be discovered via attribute.  This then opens up the possibility of loading extension DLLs for supporting new platforms.

data.title: Fix MGFX Error/Warning Line Numbers
data.body:
Back in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/1972 the MGFX compiler was switched over to use CppNet (https://github.com/xtravar/CppNet) for preprocessing.  This was the first step towards supporting GLSL.

The problem as reported in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3853 is that CppNet does not report the correct line numbers for errors in all cases.

In particular for multi-line comments or FX files with lots of includes.

We need someone to reproduce those errors and work with or fork CppNet to fix them.

Note the SiliconStudios team uses CppNet as well with what seems like some slightly different fixes to error reporting.  We should check their fork:

https://github.com/manu-silicon/CppNet

... to see if it solves our problems as well.

data.title: Fix for OpenTK messing with the window size when both fullscreen and …
data.body:
…resolution are changed.

I have noticed that if one tries to change `GraphicsDeviceManager.IsFullscreen` AND `GraphicsDeviceManager.PreferredBackBufferWidth` / Height through `GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges()` outside of the `Game` constructor, the new window size is totally wrong (the new size is basically ignored and OpenTK use a default value instead).

I have identified the cause to be OpenTK `NativeWindow.WindowState` to recalculate the window size when its state changes from `Hidden` to anything else. This overrides the setting of `NativeWindow.ClientBounds`.

This PR simply invert the order in which `NativeWindow.ClientBounds` and `NativeWindow.WindowState` are set so that `NativeWindow.ClientBounds` keeps its intended value.

@cra0zy @dellis1972

data.title: Reporting issues that are happening in Raining Blobs
data.body:
Hello guys,

here is a list of issues that happened after the Steam release:
1. Game was not working on Arch Linux with MonoGame mono kickstart.
   I got with the player and solved the issue. Since Arch Linux have newer libraries this was the issue:
   libgif.so.4 => not found
   libpng12.so.0 => not found
   And on Arch Linux he had 
   libgif.so.7 and libpng16
   He added the older libs and the game started working!
2. After making it work on Arch Linux, full screen was not working, only very small part of the full screen was showing and the rest was transparent, you could see the desktop. When going in windowed mode it was fine until he reached 1920x1080 window mode resolution.
   Also when playing in windowed mode it is not a real window but a black full screen with the game of the windowed mode resolution size.
3. I have complaint from 2nd player that the game would not start at all on Windows with ATI GPU, still have to investigate this. A while ago one friend could not start the game at all on different ATI GPU PC.
4. Game is not working properly in full screen on 4K monitors and on Mac retina displays. The background is black and the game shows in top left 1/4 of the screen. Switching to windowed mode it works fine. I have added window mode resolutions up to 4K and it works with no issues.

Hope you find this helpful and find a quick solution @cra0zy @mrhelmut @tomspilman 
I will update you as I find more issues or solutions.

Thanks,
Endi

data.title: Documentation for packaging and distributing projects
data.body:
I started working on some documentation regarding how to package desktop projects for market distribution.

This is a very early work, mostly a draft, therefore not ready to be merged.

Topics planned:
- referencing all runtime requirements for both Windows & DesktopGL projects
- using MonoKickstart
- creating OS X bundles & dmg's
- creating Linux packages
- highlighting specific requirements for Steam and most popular distribution platforms

Not planned (I lack the knowledge):
- creating an installer for Windows or DesktopGL projects
